abstract: Scientists suggest Zika virus, thought to cause infant brain damage and paralysis in adults, may be transmissible through sexual contact, not just mosquitoes; Centers for Disease Control and Prevention call for further study, but say evidence is still too slim to issue formal travel ban.
lead_paragraph: The evidence is slim, but some experts want scientists to investigate whether a virus linked to birth defects and commonly transmitted by mosquitoes could be spread sexually.

headline.main: Zika Virus: Two Cases Suggest It Could Be Spread Through Sex
headline.print_headline: Two Cases Suggest That Zika Virus Could Be Spread Through Sexual Contact

snippet: The evidence is slim, but some experts want scientists to investigate whether a virus linked to birth defects and commonly transmitted by mosquitoes could be spread sexually.

keywords.value: Centers for Disease Control and Prevention
